com.orgsync.api

Interface ApiClient


  • public interface ApiClient

    A client to the OrgSync API. A new instance can be created from the OrgSync class using one of the factory methods (e.g. OrgSync.newApiClient(String)). The client makes the various API resources avialable by providing access to the resource using getResource(Resource) with a value from the Resources class.

    The ApiClient provides access to the underlying AsyncHttpClient and also allows a user to setHttpClient(AsyncHttpClient) for any special needs. Most users will not need to access these methods.

    Finally, a client can be destroy()ed to free the underlying resources of the http client. This must be called for the JVM to exit cleanly.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void destroy()
      Clean up any resources held by the underlying http client.
      String getApiKey()
      Get the API key that is being used by this client.
      AsyncHttpClient getHttpClient()
      Get the underlying http client for this api client.
      <T> T getResource(Resource<T> resource)
      Get a specific resource from the API.
      ApiClient setHttpClient(AsyncHttpClient client)
      Set the client to use a given http client.

    • Method Detail

      • destroy

        void destroy()
        Clean up any resources held by the underlying http client. This method must be called for the application to exit cleanly.

      • getResource

        <T> T getResource(Resource<T> resource)
        Get a specific resource from the API. The valid resources are listed in the Resources class.
        Parameters:
        resource - the resource instances from Resources
        Returns:
        the resource instance

      • getApiKey

        String getApiKey()
        Get the API key that is being used by this client.
        Returns:
        the api key

      • getHttpClient

        AsyncHttpClient getHttpClient()
        Get the underlying http client for this api client.
        Returns:
        the http client

      • setHttpClient

        ApiClient setHttpClient(AsyncHttpClient client)
        Set the client to use a given http client. This allows clients to customize the values used in the http client.
        Parameters:
        client - the http client to use
        Returns:
        the api client
